alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued January 07 at 1:47PM PST until January 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For the Hard Freeze Warning and Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 25 degrees are expected. * WHERE...Cuyama Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Hard Freeze Warning, from 1 AM to 10 AM PST Monday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Damage to outdoor plumbing possible. Expect severe damage to crops or sensitive vegetation, and harm to unprotected pets or livestock.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
